title.narrative: OHCHR project: Improving the human rights at borders, including through building the capacity of border officials, in the MENA region, 2019-2020

description.narrative: The objective of the development cooperation is to strengthen respect for the human rights of migrants in migration and border governance, including by providing capacity building and strengthening on human rights to border officials, with a focus on the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region, specifically Morocco, Mauritania and Jordan . The project aims to assist selected Member States to comply with international human rights standards in their border security and governance, while taking a gender-sensitive approach, as well as to build and reinforce the capacity of civil society in the relevant countries to monitor and respond to human rights violations related to border governance. Finally, the project will also strengthen the capacity of relevant UN entities operating in the region to mainstream human rights and gender perspectives into their work as it relates to migration and border governance. In this, the project serves as concrete contribution to implementing the Global Compact for Safe, Orderly and Regular Migration, in particular Objective 11 (Manage borders in an integrated, secure and coordinated manner).

organisation.narrative: Permanent Mission of Denmark to the UN in Geneva

mailing-address.narrative: Mission permanente du Danemark auprés de l'Office des Nations Unies à Genéve, 56 rue de Moillebeau, Case Postale 435
